findings_by_domain.finding_summary: ASC joint venture with employed physicians violates STARK/AKS - remediation via buyout or OIG voluntary disclosure required
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Unwind ASC (buy out physician 50% for $1.5M-$2M) OR OIG SDP (voluntary disclosure settle $2M-$5M + CIA 3-5 years)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Tax-exempt conversion triggers $36.43M annual taxes (federal $15.12M + state $4.66M + property $10.80M + sales $5.85M)
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Tax minimization: §338(h)(10) election, bonus depreciation, JCTC, REIT lease-back, charitable contributions - reduces to $16M-$31M/year

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: IRC §141 private activity test violated upon conversion - bond redemption required at 102% = $428.4M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Finance from PE equity or refinance with taxable bonds at closing; structure into purchase price and debt financing plan

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Ohio Rev. Code §5709.12 requires recapture 4 years retroactive tax savings = $43.2M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Plan for one-time payment at closing or within 12 months; negotiate with county auditor for payment plan

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Refinancing taxable bonds at 6.5% vs. 4.25% tax-exempt = $9.45M/year additional interest
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Negotiate favorable taxable bond terms; structure into purchase price impact

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: HIPAA Security Rule violations (outdated risk analysis, inadequate backups, no encryption) - OCR penalty $500K-$1.5M + CAP $2.5M-$5M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Implement corrective actions before OCR findings: annual risk analysis, offline/immutable backups, encrypt data at rest

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: HIPAA ransomware breach class action - 850K patients, settlement likely $5M-$15M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Negotiate settlement, insurance coverage (cyber liability third-party coverage standard)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: PE integration layoffs 500-1,000 employees without 60-day notice = $5.1M-$5.4M back pay + benefits
findings_by_domain.mitigation: AVOIDABLE: Provide 60-day notice to employees, Ohio DJFS, local government before layoffs

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Physician change of control terminations (20-50 physicians) - severance + tail insurance $21M-$33M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Offer retention bonuses $50K-$150K per physician, maintain compensation guarantees 12-24 months

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: MA contract termination (1-2 of 8 plans) upon change of control = $22M-$45M annual revenue loss
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Early engagement with MA plans, emphasize quality metrics/Star Ratings contribution

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Commercial payer rate renegotiation upon for-profit conversion = $21.6M-$43.2M annual revenue loss
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Early engagement with commercial payers, emphasize quality/cost efficiency

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: 340B manufacturer restrictions (if PhRMA litigation adverse) = $3M-$5M/year savings loss
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Monitor PhRMA litigation, prepare alternative drug procurement strategies

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Medicaid MCO rate renegotiation = $20M-$40M annual revenue loss
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Emphasize Mercy South DSH status and safety-net function

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: CON 50-bed expansion denial (30-40% probability) - $125M project blocked, NPV of lost capacity $15M-$20M
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Advocacy strategy: emphasize need (occupancy 88% exceeds 80% threshold), pro forma feasibility

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: GME surgery program accreditation withdrawal (15-20% probability) - $2.5M/year GME payments at risk
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Monitor corrective action effectiveness, ensure work hours compliance sustained

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Joint Commission deemed status downgrade (5-10% probability) - 0.5-1% Medicare revenue loss if CMS surveys find CoPs deficiencies
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Immediate correction of 8 deficiencies (medication management, hand hygiene >90%, fire door, credentialing)

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates from specialist reports, based on statutory requirements, regulatory precedent, industry benchmarks, and transaction-specific factors
quantification_methodology.time_profile_classification: ONE_TIME (8 findings), PERPETUAL (7 findings) - DCF/NPV applied to perpetual exposures at 8% discount rate

valuation_methods.expected_value: Used for contingent one-time exposures (OCR penalty, class action, WARN Act, physician terminations, CON denial)
valuation_methods.npv_perpetual: Used for recurring annual exposures with no end date (taxes, payer rate reductions, 340B loss, GME payments) at 8% discount rate
valuation_methods.face_value: Used for structural one-time payments with 100% certainty (bond redemption, property tax recapture)
